result.execSummary:
The defendant Dre Colyn Mathu Walbruck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.

Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician. 
Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Dre Colyn Mathu Walbruck in court with attorney Hans R Thompson.

Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights and enters no contest plea. 
Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. 
Court orders sentence withheld, probation 1 year. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961 
- possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician
